metadata.title: A Formal Theory of Commonsense Psychology: How People Think People Think
metadata.authors: Andrew S. Gordon and Jerry R. Hobbs
metadata.description: Chapter 15 axioms covering causal complexes, agents and agenthood, enabling conditions, ability, executability, and difficulty
metadata.notation: First-order logic with reified eventualities, defeasible reasoning, and causal relations

axioms.section: 15.1 Causal Complexes and the Predicate cause
axioms.title: Causal Complex Argument Constraints
axioms.fol: (forall (s e) (if (causalComplex s e) (and (eventuality e) (or (eventualities s) (eventuality s)))))
axioms.english: If s is a causal complex for effect e, then e is an eventuality, and s is either an eventuality or a set of eventualities.

axioms.section: 15.1 Causal Complexes and the Predicate cause
axioms.title: Causal Complex Member Relevance
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 e1 e) (if (and (causalComplex s e)(member e1 s)(deleteElt s1 s e1)) (not (causalComplex s1 e))))
axioms.english: Each member of a causal complex is relevant - if any member is removed from the set, the remainder is not a causal complex for the effect.

axioms.section: 15.1 Causal Complexes and the Predicate cause
axioms.title: Cause in Causal Complex
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (cause0 e1 e2) (exists (s)(and (causalComplex s e2)(member e1 s)))))
axioms.english: A cause is an eventuality in a causal complex - if e1 causes e2, then there exists a causal complex containing e1 that results in e2.

axioms.title: Will as Direct Cause
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 a e) (if (and (will' e1 a e)(cause e1 e)) (dcause e1 e)))
axioms.english: If an agent can will an event to happen, then this willing is a direct cause of the event.

axioms.title: Agent Direct Causation
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (if (agent a) (iff (dcause a e) (exists (e1)(and (will' e1 a e)(dcause e1 e))))))
axioms.english: An agent directly causes an event if and only if the agent's willing it to happen directly causes it.

axioms.title: Enabled Causal Complex
axioms.fol: (forall (s e t) (iff (enabled s e t) (forall (e1) (if (enable0 e1 e s)(atTime e1 t)))))
axioms.english: A causal complex for an eventuality is enabled at time t if all its preconditions hold at time t.

axioms.title: Executable Action Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e a c t) (iff (executable e a c t) (exists (s) (and (enabled s e t) (or (exists (e1) (and (dcause' e1 a e)(possible e1 c))) (exists (e2) (and (cause e2 e) (executable e2 a c t))))))))
axioms.english: Action e is executable by agent a given constraints c at time t if there exists a causal complex s that brings e about and s is enabled at time t, and either the agent can directly cause e, or recursively, something that causes e is executable.

axioms.title: Difficult Action Constraint
axioms.fol: (forall (a e) (if (difficult e a)(and (agent a)(agentOf a e))))
axioms.english: If an action is difficult for an agent, then the agent must be an agent and the agent of the action.

axioms.title: Difficulties With Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (s e) (iff (difficultiesWith s e) (forall (e1) (iff (member e1 s) (exists (e2) (and (not' e2 e)(tcause e1 e2)))))))
axioms.english: The set of difficulties associated with an action is the set of eventualities that tend to cause the action not to happen.

axioms.title: Difficulty Scale Subset Consistency
axioms.fol: (forall (s s1 e) (if (and (difficultyScale s e)(difficultiesWith' e1 s e)) (subsetConsistent s e1)))
axioms.english: If the set of difficulties associated with achieving e1 contains the set of difficulties associated with achieving e2, then e1 is more difficult than e2 - difficulty scales are subset consistent.

axioms.title: Difficult Property Definition
axioms.fol: (forall (e1 e a) (iff (difficult' e1 e a) (and (agent a)(agentOf a e) (exists (s) (and (difficultyScale s e)(scaleFor s e1))))))
axioms.english: Something is difficult if it is in the Hi region of a difficulty scale - the difficulty scale is the scaleFor the difficult property.

conversion_notes.reified_predicates: Chapter extensively uses reified predicates like will', cause', changeIn', not', and', at', change', difficult', able', dcause' to represent complex causal and agential relationships
conversion_notes.defeasible_reasoning: Two axioms (15.4, 15.6) use (etc) predicate to express defeasible rules about causal transitivity and agent capabilities
conversion_notes.recursive_definitions: Axioms 15.9 and 15.31 contain recursive definitions for objectOf and executable predicates
conversion_notes.case_roles: Chapter defines linguistic case roles (agentOf, objectOf, instrumentOf, sourceOf, terminusOf) in terms of causal structure
conversion_notes.causal_theory: Comprehensive theory distinguishing causal complexes (precise, monotonic) from causes (defeasible, practical)
conversion_notes.agent_theory: Sophisticated treatment of agents as entities capable of willing events into existence
conversion_notes.cross_references: References predicates from other chapters: atTime (Ch 16), possible/likelihood/likely (Ch 20), will (Ch 19/31)

file_format_notes.section_organization: Six main sections covering causal complexes, agents, other causal predicates, ability, executability, and difficulty
file_format_notes.complexity_justification: Complex axioms involve multiple quantifiers, recursive definitions, or sophisticated logical structure with 3+ nested levels
file_format_notes.pattern_categorization: Patterns focus on definitional equivalences, type constraints, and defeasible rules characteristic of background theory
file_format_notes.predicate_summary: Chapter introduces 26 new predicates plus references to 5 predicates defined in later chapters

domain.section: 15.1 Causal Complexes and the Predicate cause
domain.title: Defeasible Transitivity of Cause
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2 e3) (if (and (cause0 e1 e2) (cause0 e2 e3) (etc)) (cause0 e1 e3)))
domain.english: Causality is defeasibly transitive - if e1 causes e2 and e2 causes e3, then typically e1 causes e3.

domain.title: Agent vs Eventuality Causation
domain.fol: (forall (a e2) (and (if (eventuality a) (iff (cause a e2)(cause0 a e2))) (if (agent a) (iff (cause a e2) (exists (e1) (and (will' e1 a e2)(cause0 e1 e2))))) (if (not (or (eventuality a)(agent a))) (not (cause a e2)))))
domain.english: Defines cause to be cause0 when the first argument is an eventuality. When the first argument is an agent, that agent's willing is the cause0 of the second argument.

domain.title: Agent Causal Capability
domain.fol: (forall (a) (if (and (agent a)(etc)) (exists (e) (cause a e))))
domain.english: The chief property of agents is that they, defeasibly, are capable of causing some events.

domain.title: Agent Case Role Definition
domain.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (agentOf a e) (and (agent a)(cause a e))))
domain.english: The agent of an event is an agent that causes it.

domain.title: Doing an Action Definition
domain.fol: (forall (a e) (iff (do a e) (and (agentOf a e)(Rexist e))))
domain.english: Agent a has done an action e if and only if a is the agent of the action and the action really takes place.

domain.title: Object Case Role Definition
domain.fol: (forall (x e) (iff (objectOf x e) (or (changeIn' e x) (exists (e1 e2) (and (and' e e1 e2)(cause e1 e2)(objectOf x e2))))))
domain.english: x is the object of an event if the event is a change in x, or recursively if the event is a causal chain of subevents, the final event of which has x as its object.

domain.title: Instrument Case Role Definition
domain.fol: (forall (y e) (iff (instrumentOf y e) (exists (a e1) (and (agentOf a e1)(changeIn' e1 y) (or (cause e1 e) (exists (e2) (and (cause e1 e2)(and' e e1 e2))))))))
domain.english: y is an instrument of an event e if the agent causes a change in y, and that causes e or the end state in e.

domain.title: Source Case Role Definition
domain.fol: (forall (z e) (iff (sourceOf z e) (exists (x w e1 e2 s) (and (at' e1 x z s)(at' e2 x w s)(change' e e1 e2)))))
domain.english: z is the source of a change event when there is a change from being at z to being at some other location w.

domain.title: Terminus Case Role Definition
domain.fol: (forall (w e) (iff (terminusOf w e) (exists (x z e1 e2 s) (and (at' e1 x z s)(at' e2 x w s)(change' e e1 e2)))))
domain.english: w is the terminus of a change event when there is a change from being at some initial location z to being at w.

domain.title: Collective Definition
domain.fol: (forall (s) (if (collective s) (forall (a) (if (member a s)(agent a)))))
domain.english: Collectives are sets of agents - if s is a collective, then every member of s is an agent.

domain.title: Causally Involved Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (causallyInvolved e1 e2) (exists (s) (and (causalComplex s e2) (member e1 s)))))
domain.english: An eventuality e1 is causally involved in bringing about some effect e if it is in some causal complex for e.

domain.title: Enable0 Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2 s) (iff (enable0 e1 e2 s) (and (causalComplex s e2) (member e1 s) (not (cause e1 e2)))))
domain.english: e1 is an enabling condition for e2 provided it is in the causal complex s that will be used to bring about e2, but is not the cause of e2.

domain.title: Universal Enable Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (enable e1 e2) (forall (s) (if (causalComplex s e2)(enable0 e1 e2 s)))))
domain.english: If an eventuality e1 is required for any way of bringing about e2, then we can use the two-argument predicate enable.

domain.title: Enable-Prevent Relationship
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (enable e1 e2) (forall (e3) (if (not' e3 e1) (exists (e4) (and (not' e4 e2)(cause e3 e4)))))))
domain.english: e1 enables e2 just in case any negation of e1 causes some negation of e2 - if an enabling condition does not hold, then the effect will not occur.

domain.title: Allow Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (allow e1 e2) (forall (e4) (if (not' e4 e2) (not (cause e1 e4))))))
domain.english: An eventuality e1 allows an eventuality e2 if e1 does not cause (not e2).

domain.title: Prevent Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (prevent e1 e2) (exists (e4) (and (not' e4 e2) (cause e1 e4)))))
domain.english: An eventuality e1 prevents e2 if e1 is the cause of (not e2).

domain.title: Partially Cause Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (partiallyCause e1 e2) (exists (e3 e4) (and (not (cause e1 e2))(not (cause e3 e2)) (and' e4 e1 e3) (cause e4 e2)))))
domain.english: An eventuality e1 partially causes another eventuality e2 if e1's conjunction with another eventuality e3 causes e2.

domain.title: Tends to Cause Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (tcause e1 e2) (exists (s c) (and (causalComplex s e2) (member e1 s) (deleteElt s1 s e1) (likely s1 c) (if (Rexist s)(cause e1 e2))))))
domain.english: e1 tends to cause e2 if e1 is in a causal complex s for e2, if the rest of s is likely, and if e1 would be singled out as a cause of e2 provided s actually obtains.

domain.title: Quantified Tends to Cause
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2 q c) (iff (tcauseq e1 e2 q c) (exists (s) (and (causalComplex s e2) (member e1 s) (deleteElt s1 s e1) (likelihood q s1 c) (if (Rexist s1)(cause e1 e2))))))
domain.english: e1 tends to cause e2 with likelihood q, given constraints c, if e1 is in a causal complex for e2, if the likelihood of the rest of s is q, and if e1 would be singled out as a cause of e2 provided the rest of s actually obtains.

domain.title: Cause Implies Tends to Cause
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (if (cause e1 e2)(tcause e1 e2)))
domain.english: The notion cause is stronger than the notion tcause - if e1 causes e2 then it tends to cause e2.

domain.title: Events Beyond Control Definition
domain.fol: (forall (s1 s a) (iff (evsBeyondControl s1 s a) (and (eventualities s)(subset s1 s)(agent a) (forall (e) (iff (member e s1) (and (not (agentOf a e)) (not (exists (e1) (and (agentOf a e1) (cause e1 e)))))))))))
domain.english: The eventualities beyond an agent a's control are the subset s1 of eventualities in a set s that a cannot bring about by a's efforts alone.

domain.title: Able Definition
domain.fol: (forall (a e c) (iff (able a e c) (exists (s s1 e1) (and (causalComplex s e)(cause' e1 a e)(member e1 s) (evsBeyondControl s1 s a) (if (Rexist s1)(possible e1 c))))))
domain.english: An agent a is able to do e, given a set of constraints c, if the agent's causing e is possible with respect to c whenever the set s1 of all the events in a causal complex s for e that are beyond a's control really exist independently.

domain.title: Ability State Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 a e c) (iff (ability e1 a e c)(able' e1 a e c)))
domain.english: e1 is a's ability to do e given constraints c if e1 is the state of a's being able to do e given constraints c.

domain.title: Direct Cause Definition
domain.fol: (forall (e1 e2) (iff (dcause e1 e2) (and (cause e1 e2) (not (exists (e3) (and (cause e1 e3)(cause e3 e2)))))))
domain.english: Direct causation occurs when there are no intermediate, mediating events - e1 directly causes e2 if e1 causes e2 but there is no intermediate event e3.
